intro: Dicyclophora caucalioides, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
